    "file_path": "h2q_project/utils/logger.py",
    "content": "import logging
import os

def setup_logger(name, log_file, level=logging.INFO):
    """To setup as many loggers as you want"""

    formatter = logging.Formatter('%(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s')

    handler = logging.FileHandler(log_file)
    handler.setFormatter(formatter)

    logger = logging.getLogger(name)
    logger.setLevel(level)
    logger.addHandler(handler)

    return logger


# Example usage (can be moved to where you initialize your training):
if __name__ == '__main__':
    log_dir = "logs"
    os.makedirs(log_dir, exist_ok=True)
    log_file_path = os.path.join(log_dir, 'training.log')
    training_logger = setup_logger('training', log_file_path)

    training_logger.info('Starting training...')
    training_logger.info('Epoch 1: loss = 0.1')
    training_logger.warning('Possible overfitting detected.')
    training_logger.error('An error occurred during training.')
    training_logger.info('Training completed.')"
